classes.name: DateTimeFormatter
classes.description: Formatter for printing and parsing date-time objects. Provides the main application entry point for formatting and parsing, with common implementations available through static factory methods and constants. Immutable and thread-safe.

methods.name: ofPattern

params.name: pattern
params.description: The pattern string, such as 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss'

returns.description: The formatter based on the pattern

methods.description: Creates a formatter using the specified pattern. Common patterns: y=year, M=month, d=day, H=hour(0-23), h=hour(1-12), m=minute, s=second, a=AM/PM, z=timezone, X=offset.

methods.name: ofPattern

params.name: pattern
params.description: The pattern string

params.name: locale
params.description: The locale to use for formatting

returns.description: The formatter based on the pattern and locale

methods.description: Creates a formatter using the specified pattern and locale.

methods.name: ofLocalizedDate

params.name: dateStyle
params.description: The date format style (FULL, LONG, MEDIUM, SHORT)

methods.description: Returns a locale specific date format for the ISO chronology.

methods.name: ofLocalizedTime

params.name: timeStyle
params.description: The time format style (FULL, LONG, MEDIUM, SHORT)

methods.description: Returns a locale specific time format for the ISO chronology.

methods.name: ofLocalizedDateTime

params.name: dateTimeStyle
params.description: The date-time format style (FULL, LONG, MEDIUM, SHORT)

methods.description: Returns a locale specific date-time format for the ISO chronology. The style is used for both date and time.

methods.name: ofLocalizedDateTime

params.name: dateStyle
params.description: The date format style (FULL, LONG, MEDIUM, SHORT)

params.name: timeStyle
params.description: The time format style (FULL, LONG, MEDIUM, SHORT)

methods.description: Returns a locale specific date-time format for the ISO chronology with separate styles for date and time.

methods.name: format

params.name: temporal
params.description: The temporal object to format (e.g., LocalDateTime, ZonedDateTime, LocalDate)

methods.description: Formats a date-time object using this formatter.

methods.name: parse

params.name: text
params.description: The text to parse

methods.description: Fully parses the text producing a temporal object. Use LocalDate.from(), LocalDateTime.from(), etc. to convert the result.

methods.name: parseBest

params.name: text
params.description: The text to parse

params.name: queries
params.description: The queries defining the types to attempt to parse to

returns.description: The parsed date-time as the best matching type

methods.description: Fully parses the text producing a temporal object of one of the specified types. Tries each query in order, returning the first successful result.

methods.name: withZone

params.name: zone
params.description: The zone to use for formatting/parsing

returns.description: A copy of this formatter with the zone override set

methods.description: Returns a copy of this formatter with a new override zone. Useful when formatting an Instant which has no zone information.

methods.name: withLocale

params.name: locale
params.description: The locale to use

returns.description: A copy of this formatter with the locale set

methods.description: Returns a copy of this formatter with a new locale.

methods.name: getZone

returns.description: The override zone, or null if no override

methods.description: Gets the overriding zone to be used during formatting.

methods.name: getLocale
methods.description: Gets the locale to be used during formatting.

methods.name: toString

returns.description: A description of the underlying format

methods.description: Returns a description of the underlying formatters.

fields.name: ISO_LOCAL_DATE
fields.description: The ISO date formatter that formats or parses a date without an offset, such as '2011-12-03'.

fields.name: ISO_LOCAL_TIME
fields.description: The ISO time formatter that formats or parses a time without an offset, such as '10:15:30'.

fields.name: ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME
fields.description: The ISO date-time formatter that formats or parses a date-time without an offset, such as '2011-12-03T10:15:30'.

fields.name: ISO_OFFSET_DATE
fields.description: The ISO date formatter that formats or parses a date with an offset, such as '2011-12-03+01:00'.

fields.name: ISO_OFFSET_TIME
fields.description: The ISO time formatter that formats or parses a time with an offset, such as '10:15:30+01:00'.

fields.name: ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME
fields.description: The ISO date-time formatter that formats or parses a date-time with an offset, such as '2011-12-03T10:15:30+01:00'.

fields.name: ISO_ZONED_DATE_TIME
fields.description: The ISO-like date-time formatter that formats or parses a date-time with offset and zone, such as '2011-12-03T10:15:30+01:00[Europe/Paris]'.

fields.name: ISO_INSTANT
fields.description: The ISO instant formatter that formats or parses an instant in UTC, such as '2011-12-03T10:15:30Z'.

fields.name: ISO_DATE
fields.description: The ISO date formatter that formats or parses a date with the offset if available, such as '2011-12-03' or '2011-12-03+01:00'.

fields.name: ISO_TIME
fields.description: The ISO time formatter that formats or parses a time with the offset if available, such as '10:15:30' or '10:15:30+01:00'.

fields.name: ISO_DATE_TIME
fields.description: The ISO-like date-time formatter that formats or parses a date-time with the offset and zone if available.

fields.name: ISO_ORDINAL_DATE
fields.description: The ISO date formatter that formats or parses the ordinal date without an offset, such as '2012-337'.

fields.name: ISO_WEEK_DATE
fields.description: The ISO date formatter that formats or parses the week-based date without an offset, such as '2012-W48-6'.

fields.name: BASIC_ISO_DATE
fields.description: The ISO date formatter that formats or parses a date without separators, such as '20111203'.

fields.name: RFC_1123_DATE_TIME
fields.description: The RFC-1123 date-time formatter, such as 'Tue, 3 Jun 2008 11:05:30 GMT'.

classes.name: DateTimeFormatterBuilder
classes.description: Builder to create date-time formatters. Allows a DateTimeFormatter to be created by composing pattern elements, literal text, and other formatters. All builders can be used as sinks for append methods.

constructors.description: Constructs a new instance of the builder.

methods.name: appendPattern

params.name: pattern
params.description: The pattern to add, such as 'yyyy-MM-dd'

methods.description: Appends the elements defined by the specified pattern to the builder. The pattern is parsed as per DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern().

methods.name: appendLiteral

params.name: literal
params.description: The literal text to append

methods.description: Appends a string literal to the formatter.

methods.name: appendValue

params.name: field
params.description: The field to append (e.g., ChronoField.YEAR)

methods.description: Appends the value of a date-time field to the formatter using a normal output style.

methods.name: appendText

params.name: field
params.description: The field to append text for (e.g., ChronoField.MONTH_OF_YEAR)

methods.description: Appends the text of a date-time field to the formatter using the full text style.

methods.name: appendZoneId
methods.description: Appends the time-zone ID, such as 'Europe/Paris' or '+02:00', to the formatter.

methods.name: appendZoneText

params.name: style
params.description: The text style to use (FULL, SHORT, NARROW)

methods.description: Appends the time-zone name, such as 'British Summer Time', to the formatter.

methods.name: appendOffset

params.name: pattern
params.description: The pattern to use, such as '+HH:MM:ss'

params.name: noOffsetText
params.description: The text to use when the offset is zero, such as 'Z'

methods.description: Appends the zone offset, such as '+01:00', to the formatter.

methods.name: optionalStart
methods.description: Mark the start of an optional section. The output of formatting can include all, some, or none of the optional section.

methods.name: optionalEnd
methods.description: Ends an optional section. Every call to optionalStart() must eventually be matched by a call to optionalEnd().

methods.name: padNext

params.name: padWidth
params.description: The pad width, must be 1 or greater

methods.description: Causes the next added printer/parser to pad to a fixed width using a space.

methods.name: parseCaseInsensitive
methods.description: Changes the parse style to be case insensitive for the remainder of the formatter.

methods.name: parseCaseSensitive
methods.description: Changes the parse style to be case sensitive for the remainder of the formatter.

methods.name: parseStrict
methods.description: Changes the parse style to be strict for the remainder of the formatter.

methods.name: parseLenient
methods.description: Changes the parse style to be lenient for the remainder of the formatter. Lenient parsing allows the input to not precisely match the format.

methods.name: toFormatter
methods.description: Completes this builder by creating the DateTimeFormatter using the default locale.

methods.name: toFormatter

params.name: locale
params.description: The locale to use for formatting

returns.description: The created formatter with the specified locale

methods.description: Completes this builder by creating the DateTimeFormatter using the specified locale.

classes.name: FormatStyle
classes.description: Enumeration of the style of a localized date, time, or date-time formatter. These styles are used when obtaining a date-time style from DateTimeFormatter.

methods.name: valueOf

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the enum constant (FULL, LONG, MEDIUM, SHORT)

returns.description: The enum constant with the specified name

methods.description: Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.

methods.name: values

returns.description: An array containing the constants of this enum type

methods.description: Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.

fields.name: FULL
fields.description: Full text style, with the most detail. For example, the format might be 'Tuesday, April 12, 1952 AD' or '3:30:42pm PST'.

fields.name: LONG
fields.description: Long text style, with lots of detail. For example, the format might be 'January 12, 1952'.

fields.name: MEDIUM
fields.description: Medium text style, with some detail. For example, the format might be 'Jan 12, 1952'.

fields.name: SHORT
fields.description: Short text style, typically numeric. For example, the format might be '12.13.52' or '3:30pm'.

classes.name: TextStyle
classes.description: Enumeration of the style of text formatting and parsing. Text styles define how text is printed and parsed for date-time fields such as day-of-week and month-of-year.

methods.name: valueOf

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the enum constant

returns.description: The enum constant with the specified name

methods.description: Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.

methods.name: values

returns.description: An array containing the constants of this enum type

methods.description: Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.

methods.name: isStandalone

returns.description: True if this style is a standalone style

methods.description: Returns true if the style is a standalone style. Standalone styles are used when the field is displayed alone, such as a month name in a calendar grid.

methods.name: asStandalone

returns.description: The standalone equivalent of this style

methods.description: Returns the standalone style with the same size as this style. Returns this if already standalone.

methods.name: asNormal

returns.description: The normal equivalent of this style

methods.description: Returns the normal style with the same size as this style. Returns this if already normal.

fields.name: FULL
fields.description: Full text, typically the full description. For example, 'Monday' for day-of-week or 'January' for month-of-year.

fields.name: FULL_STANDALONE
fields.description: Full text for stand-alone use, typically the full description. Used when the text is displayed alone, such as in a calendar.

fields.name: SHORT
fields.description: Short text, typically an abbreviation. For example, 'Mon' for day-of-week or 'Jan' for month-of-year.

fields.name: SHORT_STANDALONE
fields.description: Short text for stand-alone use, typically an abbreviation. Used when the text is displayed alone.

fields.name: NARROW
fields.description: Narrow text, typically a single letter. For example, 'M' for day-of-week or 'J' for month-of-year.

fields.name: NARROW_STANDALONE
fields.description: Narrow text for stand-alone use, typically a single letter. Used when the text is displayed alone.
